document.title: Inventing Metaphors to Understand the Genre of Poetry
document.abstract: To make personally meaningful connections with poetry as a genre, students in the author's seventh grade classes generated original metaphors to describe the essence of poetry.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Phyllis Whitin was an Assistant Professor of Elementary and Early Childhood Education at Queens College, CUNY. Her research interests include investigating multiple forms of expression, metaphor as a tool for understanding, and interdisciplinary learning. Currently: Associate Professor of Elementary Education, Wayne State University, Detroit Michigan. phyllis.whitin@wayne.edu
